feed.title: Stories by Shivangi Dixit on Medium
feed.description: Stories by Shivangi Dixit on Medium

items.title: Why you should never date a developer
items.author: Shivangi Dixit
items.description:
They make promises that are always “Async”, leaving you “Awaiting” forever. They’ll say they’ll “Callback”, but you’ll end up handling “Rejections” on your own.

They can’t handle the State of the relationship and always try to “Componentize” their feelings. Their point of “Vue” toward life is “Next-level” as they Watch every Action closely, Fetching both the good and the bad to Mount the best experience on their <head>. But in the end, they’ll just “Vue” your message and leave.

Angular developers aren’t much better. They can’t handle the dynamic nature of relationships, always needing a strict structure. They don’t know how to Express(.js) their feelings, opting to silently Node(.js) it all down. And just like Java guys, who OBJECTify everything, Angular developers will try to fit you into their predefined Models and Services.

Date a Linux guy instead;They’ll Await you if you’re away, instead of branching off to someone else. Plus, they’re single-threaded – no cheating here!

So, anyone who is up for a Date.now() do reconsider your thoughts also React and Angular developers do give you the flexibility to be of any Type, and they demand Less. But be warned: it’s a complicated codebase to navigate!

items.title: The Web Dev Bytes : 10 Trendy Topics You Can’t Afford to Miss
items.author: Shivangi Dixit
items.description:
Welcome to the wild and whimsical world of web development, where new technologies pop up faster than memes on Reddit! If you’re a developer trying to keep your head above water, fear not. This article will guide you through the latest trends that are not only hot but also pretty darn cool. And don’t worry, I promise to keep it light-hearted because, let’s face it, we all need a good laugh between debugging sessions.

1 WebAssembly: The Browser’s Secret Weapon

Imagine running near-native speed applications in your browser. No, this isn’t a Marvel movie, it’s WebAssembly (Wasm)! Dive into how Wasm is giving JavaScript a run for its money and bringing performance boosts that would make your grandma’s dial-up modem cry tears of joy.

2. Jamstack: The Delicious New Recipe for Web Development

Jamstack isn’t a new breakfast trend; it’s a modern architecture that’s all about JavaScript, APIs, and Markup. Learn why developers are jamming on this stack and how it’s making websites faster, more secure, and easier to scale.

3. Progressive Web Apps: Marrying Web and Mobile Apps

PWAs are like the Swiss Army knives of web development. They combine the best of web and mobile apps, ensuring your site can work offline, send push notifications, and generally act like it’s too cool for school. learn how to build your own PWA and why they’re the next big thing.

4. Serverless Architecture: Servers? We Don’t Need No Stinking Servers!

Okay, there are still servers involved, but with serverless architecture, you don’t have to manage them. It’s like having your cake and eating it too. Find out how services like AWS Lambda are letting developers deploy code without worrying about infrastructure.

5. Micro Frontends: Small Pieces, Big Benefits

If monolithic front-end applications are giving you nightmares, micro frontends are your dream come true. Think of them as the Voltron of web development: smaller, independent parts that combine to form something epic.

6. Web3 and DApps: The Blockchain Revolution

The future of the internet is decentralized, and Web3 is leading the charge. We’ll explore how to develop decentralized applications (DApps) and why integrating blockchain into your web projects is both the future and a pretty cool way to impress your friends.

7. Headless CMS: Off with Their Heads!

No, we’re not going medieval. Headless CMS is all about separating the content from the presentation layer. It’s the ultimate in content flexibility, allowing you to deliver your content anywhere and everywhere through APIs.

8. Performance Optimization: Speed is King

In the race for web performance, every millisecond counts. Discover modern techniques like lazy loading, code splitting, and using CDNs to make your website fast enough to leave your competitors in the dust.

9.AI and Machine Learning: The Robots Are Here to Help

AI isn’t just for sci-fi movies anymore. It’s becoming a staple in web development. Learn about practical applications of AI and ML in your web projects, from chatbots that don’t ghost your customers to personalized content recommendations that feel like they’re reading your mind.

10. Static Site Generators: Fast, Secure, and SEO-Friendly

Static site generators like Gatsby, Hugo, and Jekyll are all the rage for creating websites that are blazingly fast and incredibly secure. We’ll dive into the pros and cons of each and help you choose the right one for your next project.

So grab your favorite beverage, put on your geekiest t-shirt, and let’s dive into the wonderful world of web development trends. Who knows, you might just discover your next big project – or at the very least, a few good laughs along the way!

Till then stay tuned !

Regards

-Vaishnavi

items.title: Unleash Your Creativity: The Most Important Skill to Learn in 2024 – Generative AI
items.author: Shivangi Dixit
items.description:
Hey there, future innovators! As we step into the technologically advanced world of 2024, one skill stands out above the rest: Generative Artificial Intelligence (AI). In this blog post, we’ll explore why Generative AI is the must-have skill of the year, its incredible benefits, and guess what? I’ve got an exciting announcement for you at the end!

The Power of Generative AI

Generative AI, a subset of artificial intelligence, focuses on creating new content rather than just analyzing existing data. From generating art and music to writing stories and designing products, the possibilities are endless with Generative AI. By leveraging algorithms and machine learning techniques, Generative AI can produce content that is both novel and high-quality, pushing the boundaries of creativity like never before.

Benefits Galore

Now, you might be wondering, “Why should I bother learning Generative AI?” Well, buckle up because the benefits are out of this world:

  1. Unleash Your Creativity:Generative AI opens up a whole new world of creative possibilities. Whether you’re an artist, writer, musician, or designer, Generative AI can serve as your ultimate muse, sparking inspiration and pushing the limits of your imagination.

2. Automate Repetitive Tasks:Tired of mundane tasks like generating design variations or writing repetitive code? Generative AI can automate these tasks, freeing up your time to focus on more meaningful and impactful work.

3. Personalized Experiences: From personalized recommendations to tailored user experiences, Generative AI can enhance customer engagement and satisfaction by delivering content that resonates with individual preferences and interests.

4. Innovate Faster:With Generative AI, you can rapidly prototype and iterate on new ideas, enabling faster innovation and experimentation across various domains.

Google’s Gift to You

Now, for the moment you’ve all been waiting for. Drumroll, please… Google is offering a. Free course on Generative AI! That’s right, you heard it here first. Whether you’re a seasoned developer or a curious beginner, this course is your ticket to unlocking the full potential of Generative AI. Learn from industry experts, get hands-on experience with cutting-edge tools and techniques, and join a community of like-minded enthusiasts passionate about pushing the boundaries of creativity.

So what are you waiting for? check out google skill boost for a free upskill experience Don’t miss out on this golden opportunity to level up your skills and dive into the exciting world of Generative AI. Your journey to unleashing your creativity starts now!

Conclusion

In conclusion, Generative AI is undoubtedly the most important skill to learn in 2024. With its power to unleash creativity, automate tasks, personalize experiences, and drive innovation, Generative AI holds the key to shaping the future of technology and beyond. And with Google’s free course on Generative AI, there’s never been a better time to embark on this transformative journey. So go ahead, embrace the future, and let your creativity soar with Generative AI. Happy learning!

-Vaishnavi Dixit

items.title: Git Giggles: A Hilarious Guide to Essential Commands for Every Developer
items.author: Shivangi Dixit
items.description:
Mastering Git: A Beginner’s Guide to Essential Commands

Hey there fellow developers! Are you ready to embark on a journey to Git mastery? Buckle up your seatbelts because we’re about to dive into the wonderful world of version control with Git. Whether you’re a seasoned developer or just starting out, mastering Git is essential for smooth collaboration and efficient project management. In this interactive and fun-filled blog post, we’ll explore some basic Git commands that every developer should know, sprinkled with humor and code snippets to keep you entertained along the way. Let’s git started!

Initializing a Repository

First things first, let’s create a new Git repository. Open your terminal and navigate to the desired directory. Then, run the following command:

git init

Congratulations! You’ve just birthed a brand new Git repository. It’s like watching your code baby take its first steps.

Adding and Committing Changes

Now that we have our repository set up, let’s add some files and commit our changes. But wait, before we do that, let’s check the status of our repository:

git status

Ah, the classic “git status” command – the ultimate truth-teller of the Git universe. It tells you what’s going on in your repository and what needs attention.

Next, let’s add some files to the staging area:

git add <file1> <file2> …

Or if you’re feeling lazy (like me most of the time), you can add all the modified files at once:

git add .

Once our files are staged, it’s time to commit:

git commit -m “Your commit message here”

Remember, commit messages are like love notes to your future self and your collaborators. Be descriptive, but not too clingy.

Branching Out

Ah, branching – every developer’s favorite pastime. Let’s create a new branch for our experimental features:

git branch feature-branch

But why stop there? Let’s switch to our newly created branch:

git checkout feature-branch

Or if you’re feeling fancy and want to combine branching and switching in one go:

git checkout -b feature-branch

Now you’re in your own little world, free to experiment and break things without affecting the main branch. Just remember to clean up your mess before merging!

Merging and Rebasing

Speaking of merging, let’s bring our changes back to the main branch. First, switch to the main branch:

git checkout main

Then, merge your changes from the feature branch:

git merge feature-branch

Or if you’re feeling adventurous and want a cleaner commit history, you can rebase instead:

git rebase feature-branch

Just be careful not to get lost in the rebase abyss – it’s a dark and treacherous place.

Pushing and Pulling

Last but not least, let’s share our beautiful code with the world. Push your changes to the remote repository:

git push origin main

And if you’re collaborating with others, don’t forget to pull in their changes:

git pull origin main

Ah, the joys of teamwork – like a perfectly synchronized dance, but with fewer sequins and more merge conflicts.

Conclusion

And there you have it, folks! A whirlwind tour of some basic Git commands to kickstart your version control journey. Remember, Git is your friend (most of the time), so don’t be afraid to experiment and make mistakes. After all, that’s how we learn and grow as developers. Happy gitting!

Now go forth and conquer the Gitverse, armed with your newfound knowledge and a sprinkle of humor. Until next time, may your commits be clean and your merge conflicts few and far between. Happy coding!

-Vaishnavi Dixit

items.title: REACT V/s ANGULAR WHICH WAY️ TO GO ?
items.author: Shivangi Dixit
items.description:
React vs. Angular: Choosing the Right Framework for Beginners

Are you new to web development and trying to decide which framework to learn first? React and Angular are two of the most popular choices, each with its own set of strengths and learning curves. In this blog post, we’ll compare React and Angular from the perspective of beginners to help you make an informed decision.

Understanding React

React, developed by Facebook, is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It’s known for its simplicity, flexibility, and a vibrant ecosystem of libraries and tools. Here are some key points to consider for beginners:

  1. **Declarative Syntax**: React uses a declarative approach, which means you describe what you want to render, and React takes care of updating the UI to match your desired state.

2. **Component-Based Architecture**: React applications are built using reusable components, making it easier to manage and maintain code, especially as your project grows.

3. **Virtual DOM**: React’s virtual DOM efficiently updates only the parts of the actual DOM that have changed, leading to better performance and smoother user experiences.

4. **Community Support**: React has a large and active community, with abundant resources, tutorials, and third-party libraries available for beginners to learn and leverage.

Exploring Angular

Angular, developed by Google, is a comprehensive framework for building web applications. It provides a more opinionated structure compared to React, which can be beneficial for beginners in some ways:

  1. **Full-Featured Framework**: Angular offers a complete solution for building applications, including routing, forms handling, HTTP client, and more, all within the framework itself.

2. **Two-Way Data Binding**: Angular’s two-way data binding simplifies the synchronization between the model and the view, reducing the amount of boilerplate code required for managing state.

3. **TypeScript Support**: Angular is built with TypeScript, a statically typed superset of JavaScript, which provides enhanced tooling, error checking, and overall developer experience, especially for those coming from strongly typed languages.

4. **Official Documentation**: Angular’s documentation is comprehensive and well-maintained, making it easier for beginners to get started and find answers to their questions.

Choosing the Right Framework for Beginners

Both React and Angular have their strengths, and the choice ultimately depends on your specific needs, preferences, and learning style. Here are some factors to consider:

  • **Learning Curve**: React’s minimalistic approach may be easier for beginners to grasp initially, whereas Angular’s opinionated structure might require more time to learn comprehensively.
  • **Project Requirements**: Consider the requirements of your project. If you need a full-featured framework with built-in tools and conventions, Angular might be a better fit. If you prefer a more lightweight and flexible library, React could be the way to go.
  • **Future Career Prospects**: Evaluate the demand for React and Angular skills in the job market and the types of projects or companies you’re interested in working with.
  • **Personal Preference**: Ultimately, choose the framework that resonates with you and aligns with your long-term goals as a developer.

Conclusion

Both React and Angular are powerful frameworks with their own set of advantages and learning curves. For beginners, React may offer a gentler introduction to web development, thanks to its simplicity and vibrant community. On the other hand, Angular provides a comprehensive solution with strong opinions and built-in features, which can be beneficial for certain projects and learning styles. Whichever framework you choose, remember that the most important thing is to keep learning, building, and honing your skills as a web developer. Happy coding!

-Vaishnavi Dixit

items.title: Introvert-A Strengthening silence: Hear me
items.author: Shivangi Dixit
items.description:
Don’t be fooled by my quiet exterior. It hides a wild mind and passionate heart.

There is a tremendous difference between alone and lonely. You could be lonely in a group of people. I like being alone. I like eating by myself. I go home at night and just watch a movie or hang out with myself. I have to exert myself and really say, oh God, I’ve got to see my friends because I’m too content by myself.

Solitude matters and for some people, it's the air they breathe. I’m very picky with whom I give my energy. I prefer to reserve my time, intensity, and spirit exclusively for those who reflect sincerity. I like getting my energy from dealing with ideas, pictures, memories, and reactions that are inside my head in my inner world. I prefer doing things alone or with one or two people I feel comfortable with. I take time to reflect so that I have a clear idea of what I’ll be doing when I decide to act. Ideas are almost solid things for me.

My Hobbies

Imagining myself in a situation that will literally never exist.

I can’t stand small talk but I can talk about life for hours with that one person close to me.

I enjoy being isolated rather than being in a family get-together.

I prefer observing a person before getting in touch.

I am a very private person you don't ask I don't tell.

I have my own small Little Happy world and I love being around it.

The Surprising Benefits of Being an Introvert

Although there are a lot of misconceptions about introverts — like that they’re antisocial, unfriendly, shy, or lonely. But in many cases, being an introvert can actually be an asset.

While we’re all often flooded with messages that we need to speak up and stand out in order to be successful, introverts can actually achieve even more if they hone their natural strengths

We’re good listeners

Introverts are naturally adept when it comes to actively listening. We tend to be the friend or colleagues you can call on when you’re upset or you have good news to share. We’re going to be able to listen and be with you in that, without turning it around and making it a breaking news.

We think before speaking

Because introverts typically feel less comfortable speaking than they do listening, they choose their words wisely. We only speak when we have something to say, so there is a higher chance that we will have an impact on our words.

We make quality friends

We notice things others might not notice because we’re talking and processing out loud. The typical introvert also uses his or her observant nature to read the room. They’re more likely to notice people’s body language and facial expressions, which makes them better at interpersonal communication

We are observant

Since introverts can feel their energy being drained by being around other people — as opposed to extroverts, who gain energy from being with other introverts choose their friends wisely. we would rather have a few close, trusted friendships to invest their time and energy in, as opposed to a large network of acquaintances.

compassionate leaders

We can be the best leaders when we channel our natural strengths. For starters, we don’t feel the need to step into the spotlight and take all of the credit for group successes; rather, we are likely to highlight the strengths of our team.

Final Thoughts

When a Introvert needs space that means that maybe I am feeling down and chances are that I wont’t actually go to you for help.In fact I won’t go to anyone for help.You will actually have to check on me .I don’t feel that I should burden others with my problems but if you come to me I might just trust you enough to let you help and yes, we are misunderstood as an arrogant person but that really doesn’t matter to me because being straight forward is what i love and appreciate the most.

Stay true to your own nature. If you like to do things in a slow and steady way, don’t let others make you feel as if you have to race. If you enjoy depth, don’t force yourself to seek breadth
items.content:
Don’t be fooled by my quiet exterior. It hides a wild mind and passionate heart.

There is a tremendous difference between alone and lonely. You could be lonely in a group of people. I like being alone. I like eating by myself. I go home at night and just watch a movie or hang out with myself. I have to exert myself and really say, oh God, I’ve got to see my friends because I’m too content by myself.

Solitude matters and for some people, it's the air they breathe. I’m very picky with whom I give my energy. I prefer to reserve my time, intensity, and spirit exclusively for those who reflect sincerity. I like getting my energy from dealing with ideas, pictures, memories, and reactions that are inside my head in my inner world. I prefer doing things alone or with one or two people I feel comfortable with. I take time to reflect so that I have a clear idea of what I’ll be doing when I decide to act. Ideas are almost solid things for me.

My Hobbies

Imagining myself in a situation that will literally never exist.

I can’t stand small talk but I can talk about life for hours with that one person close to me.

I enjoy being isolated rather than being in a family get-together.

I prefer observing a person before getting in touch.

I am a very private person you don't ask I don't tell.

I have my own small Little Happy world and I love being around it.

The Surprising Benefits of Being an Introvert

Although there are a lot of misconceptions about introverts — like that they’re antisocial, unfriendly, shy, or lonely. But in many cases, being an introvert can actually be an asset.

While we’re all often flooded with messages that we need to speak up and stand out in order to be successful, introverts can actually achieve even more if they hone their natural strengths

We’re good listeners

Introverts are naturally adept when it comes to actively listening. We tend to be the friend or colleagues you can call on when you’re upset or you have good news to share. We’re going to be able to listen and be with you in that, without turning it around and making it a breaking news.

We think before speaking

Because introverts typically feel less comfortable speaking than they do listening, they choose their words wisely. We only speak when we have something to say, so there is a higher chance that we will have an impact on our words.

We make quality friends

We notice things others might not notice because we’re talking and processing out loud. The typical introvert also uses his or her observant nature to read the room. They’re more likely to notice people’s body language and facial expressions, which makes them better at interpersonal communication

We are observant

Since introverts can feel their energy being drained by being around other people — as opposed to extroverts, who gain energy from being with other introverts choose their friends wisely. we would rather have a few close, trusted friendships to invest their time and energy in, as opposed to a large network of acquaintances.

compassionate leaders

We can be the best leaders when we channel our natural strengths. For starters, we don’t feel the need to step into the spotlight and take all of the credit for group successes; rather, we are likely to highlight the strengths of our team.

Final Thoughts

When a Introvert needs space that means that maybe I am feeling down and chances are that I wont’t actually go to you for help.In fact I won’t go to anyone for help.You will actually have to check on me .I don’t feel that I should burden others with my problems but if you come to me I might just trust you enough to let you help and yes, we are misunderstood as an arrogant person but that really doesn’t matter to me because being straight forward is what i love and appreciate the most.

Stay true to your own nature. If you like to do things in a slow and steady way, don’t let others make you feel as if you have to race. If you enjoy depth, don’t force yourself to seek breadth

items.title: SEO-The Visibility Trend Setter
items.author: Shivangi Dixit
items.description:
Google only loves you when everyone else loves you first.

SEO is an asset. It’s like buying real estate and investing to remodel your kitchen and bath. That work will increase the value of your home so that you can sell it in the future for a profit.

Using SEO tricks or hacks is like trying to beat the house in Vegas. Sure, you might get a couple of quick wins, but in the long run, you’re bound to lose because “the house always wins.”

GOAL OF SEO

The goal of SEO is not to rank #1. The goal is to generate leads and sales for your business.

When you design your website for Google’s search engine spider, then you’re ignoring the most important part of SEO — your customers. At the end of the day, ranking #1 in Google is completely worthless if your website is not designed properly to convert that traffic into leads and sales!

How does SEO work?

Search engines such as Google and Bing use bots to crawl pages on the web, going from site to site, collecting information about those pages, and putting them in an index. Next, algorithms analyze pages in the index, taking into account hundreds of ranking factors or signals, to determine the order pages should appear in the search results for a given query.

Search ranking factors can be considered proxies for aspects of the user experience. Our Periodic Table of SEO Factors organizes the factors into six main categories and weights each based on its overall importance to SEO. For example, content quality and keyword research are key factors of content optimization, and crawlability and mobile-friendliness are important sites architecture factors.

The search algorithms are designed to surface relevant, authoritative pages and provide users with an efficient search experience. Optimizing your site and content with these factors in mind can help your pages rank higher in the search results.

Unlike paid search ads, you can’t pay search engines to get higher organic search rankings.

The Popularity Factor

If your prospective customers are searching in Google, Bing, and Yahoo to find your products or services, then you need an SEO strategy. More and more people are using multiple channels to research products and services and search engines are often part of the mix.

So even if you’re using other tactics like TV, radio, and print, you still need an SEO strategy to ensure you’re not losing customers when they turn to the internet to do more research.

How does Google determine what is “best”?

Google’s mission is to organize all the information online and present it so that the “best” is at the top of the search results.

Google’s algorithm takes into account many factors, but one of the most important signals is the number of websites that reference, or link, to the information. Each link is like a vote in that website’s favor telling Google that it deserves to rank high in the search results.

Trick or Treat

“Successful SEO is not about tricking Google. It’s about PARTNERING with Google to provide the best search results for Google’s users.” — Phil Frost, Main Street ROI

One of the big misconceptions about SEO is that it’s all about tricking Google to get your website to rank high.

Again, it’s important to consider Google’s mission. They want to organize all the information online and present it to the searcher so that only the best websites are at the top of the results page.

With that in mind, the goal of SEO is to make it as easy as possible for Google to find your website (by using proper HTML code, writing relevant copy, designing for ease of use, optimizing page load speed) and then to give Google a reason to rank your website higher than all the other relevant websites (by publishing better and more robust information, getting more links, more online PR).

Getting More Traffic Or Reaching Target Audience?

Today it’s not about ‘get the traffic’ — it’s about ‘get the targeted and relevant traffic.

Again, the goal of SEO is not to rank #1, it’s to generate leads and sales.

That means your SEO strategy starts with finding the right keywords that will ultimately drive conversions for your business. Use Google’s Keywords Planner Tool to search for relevant keywords. Then take it one step further to organize all the keywords you find into two categories:

  1. buying-intent
  2. research-intent

As you can probably guess, the buying-intent keywords are the ones where the person searching is most likely looking to make a purchase. The research-intent keywords are the ones where the searcher is most likely just doing research.

Focus your SEO efforts on the buying-intent keywords first to give you the best chance to drive leads and sales.

The Conversation Rate

(Traffic to your website) x (Conversion rate) = (leads or sales)

Your conversion rate is the number of leads or sales you generate from your website divided by the total number of visitors. As you can see from that equation, you can either double your traffic or double your conversion rate and the result will be the same.

How can you double your conversion rate? Try some of the following ideas:

  • Present a stronger, more compelling offer
  • Change the layout of your pages so that your offer is easier to see
  • Offer free information in exchange for an email address so you can follow up and convert over a longer time frame
  • Use retargeting ads to bring prospects (that didn’t convert) back to your website
  • Add a lightbox popup so your offer can’t be missed

THE CONTENT

Better content is outweighing more content.

This quote highlights a recent shift in SEO.

In the past, publishing more and more content was a great tactic to expand the reach of your SEO. For example, as you publish more articles about different topics, your website has more opportunities to rank on Google.

However, many businesses took that tactic to the extreme and started to publish low-quality articles in an attempt to scale up article production at lower costs.

Due to Google’s recent algorithm updates, quality outweighs quantity. Always keep this in mind and resist the urge to cut corners on quality in an attempt to publish web pages faster

Why is SEO important for marketing?

SEO is a fundamental part of digital marketing because people conduct trillions of searches every year, often with commercial intent to find information about products and services. Search is often the primary source of digital traffic for brands and complements other marketing channels. Greater visibility and ranking higher in search results than your competition can have a material impact on your bottom line.

However, the search results have been evolving over the past few years to give users more direct answers and information that is more likely to keep users on the results page instead of driving them to other websites.

Also note, features like rich results and Knowledge Panels in the search results can increase visibility and provide users more information about your company directly in the results.

SEO is like a resume you polish it so you have your best foot forward.

@shiviD

items.title: How To Realize If Someone Genuinely Loves You
items.author: Shivangi Dixit
items.description:
Let's flip a coin, Heads — “And I am your Tails” — “And you are mine”

They acknowledge your differences instead of trying to change you. No matter how much you and your partner share, you’re different people, so you won’t feel the same way about everything. Someone who loves you will accept your individual ideas and feelings as part of who you are.

You see, when someone loves you, they don’t make excuses, they don’t hide things from you, they want to spend time with you, and definitely more than once every two weeks. They don’t keep your relationship secret. And most importantly, you feel emotionally secure.

Here’s what you’ll see when someone actually loves you.

See if the person can act naturally around you

The art of being in love means being completely open to the other person. If you find yourself seeing a whole different side that the person doesn’t show the public, then that may be love. For instance, if your partner is pretty serious or polite in public, but shows a more goofy and silly side when you’re alone, then they are really opening up to you and love you.

  • If the person shares their deepest emotions with you and is comfortable with it, then that could be love.
  • If the person is comfortable not looking perfect, tripping, or having food stuck in their teeth around you, that means they are okay if you see every side of them.
  • If the person is carefree around you and realizes that how he looks doesn't matter and feels like homies when around you.

There is Emotional Intimacy

A PERSON who cherishes and makes feel emotionally secure. having emotional intimacy is a feeling where the relationship is a bubble of safety .

“emotional intimacy involves candid, authentic sharing of thoughts and feelings. It also involves being able to tell each other your deepest fears, dreams, disappointments, and most complicated emotions, as well as feeling seen and understood when you do.”

This type of intimacy requires a certain level of transparency and vulnerability. And couples who engage in this level of connectivity enjoy a sense of being at peace within themselves and with each other.

They Make Your Time Together a Priority

When someone loves you, they make you a priority, because they love to spend quality time with you. They crave that time together, and they try to make it special every time.

They Love to Make Your Life Easier

You see, when someone loves you, they do small things for you out of love, without wanting anything in return.

feeling motivated to make your partner’s life easier is one of the clearest signs of love.

They Introduce You to Their Loved Ones and Want the World to Know You Are Together

When someone loves you, they not only want to introduce you to their loved ones; they also want to know about your world and become part of it.

They Include You in Their Future Plans

If someone starts speaking about a future with you, it’s a sign that they are falling in love or are already in love with you.

Someone who is in love with you includes you in their short and long-term decisions, always.

You Feel Emotionally Secure

As I mentioned, emotional security is one of the most important aspects of a satisfying connection in a relationship. In fact, everyone needs to feel emotionally secure before being able to be vulnerable — and vulnerability is what allows us to deeply connect with someone.

Feeling emotionally secure means feeling internally relaxed with another person. And it also means that we feel free to let down our guard and show our most authentic selves.

Now you might ask, “What exactly makes us feel emotionally secure in a relationship?”

defensiveness is one of the key factors that can lead to troubled relationships.

As when it comes to defensiveness, what we often defend against is potential criticism, blaming, shaming, or rejection. So, when a partner doesn’t make us feel criticized, and there is no blaming, shaming, or rejection, we feel emotionally secure.

Final Thoughts

When someone genuinely loves you, they don’t just say “I love you,” they consistently show you they care through their actions. They are there for you every day, and you feel they’re being authentic. Most importantly, the relationship is a secure environment, where each partner can be their authentic self.

It can’t be overstressed that when it comes to love, actions do, genuinely speak far louder than words, while that love, if genuine and real, should also be unconditional. Love should never be used as a bargaining tool or an emotional weapon.

The love of someone, if genuine, should make you feel complete, confident, and cherished. If someone tells you they love you, but you feel pressured, uncomfortable, and insecure, then those words are not being backed up with the actions of a loving person.

Though it is hard, sometimes we have to listen to our head, rather than our heart, if we have any doubts about the authenticity of someone’s love.

— “SOMETIMES THE HEART SEES WHAT IS INVISIBLE TO THE EYE”

@shiviD

items.title: Digital Marketing -The Only Fashion That Never Fades!
items.author: Shivangi Dixit
items.description:
social media is changing the world and we are here witnessing it

It is a rapidly evolving field and hence studying and being updated is dominant. Giving us the ability to potentially reach Billions of people. In layman terms, Where traditional marketing was about pushing our message out, digital marketing is about using a message to pull people but there are a lot of channels and aspects towards it.

all you’d ever need in this journey is — A Reason, Efforts, Google and patience

Here are some words of wisdom,

As it’s a fast-paced industry offering lots of challenges along with rewards, a career that is always on the move and always changing some trainings and courses will help to get our foot in the door.

As Digital Marketing has evolved into an unstoppable force leading the way towards the competitive landscape, the Market is under compulsion to take up policies to stick on the battleground so as to achieve relevancy, profitability, and leads.

In order to cope with this nagging market scenario, the development of a strategic roadmap that bridges the gap between understanding customers’ end-to-end journeys and expectations and organization’s business objectives is a real challenge thus a framework for designing, implementing and managing a successful digital marketing strategy is a pre-requisite

PROGRAM BENEFITS

To be familiar with various platforms of social and digital media so as to scrutinize the big picture into a canvas building foundations of marketing strategies developing the required skills that align as per the business goals to reach target audiences and learn how to incorporate them creatively in the organization.

The course is ideal for-

For those having an online presence of there business such as entrepreneurs, marketing managers, marketing specialists, Mid-level marketers, Professionals, executives need to opt to have expertized in this field to understand their business drivers and to extend their limits,

Curriculum

To become a successful Digital Marketer, a comprehensive curriculum covering different digital marketing disciplines will help you,
  • Grow your Business
  • Make Money
  • Land a High-Paying Job
  • Work as a Freelance Marketer

Top Digital Marketing Courses

Want to give your marketing career a boost? here are some of the handpicked digital marketing courses.

As search engines keep updating their algorithms to provide a better experience to its users, a person heading towards this field is expected to be skilled in a variety of areas, including analytics, copywriting, creative direction, sales, etc.

SEO
Content Marketing
PPC
Affiliate Marketing
Social Media Marketing
Search Engine Optimization
Email Marketing
Paid Search Advertising (Google Ads and Facebook)
Web Analytics
Content Marketing
Conversion Optimization

Highlights

To optimize presence in social media, marketers employ various strategies to target prospects by taking advantage of every innovation,

According to a report, a whopping 47% of companies have no particular marketing strategies and further employ no particular efforts to reevaluate a strong digital foundation. digital marketing has a lot to offer, being specific about what skills and courses one has to move upon we can have plenty of options at disposal moving quickly and adeptly that will make one stand out of the crowd.
“Technology allows people to maintain rich connections. Expressiveness and inventiveness can always master over big marketing propagandas
Maintaining a two-way communication is the best way to help traditional marketing efforts convert into sales with boundless opportunities.”

The course is ideal for-

For those having an online presence of there business such as entrepreneurs, marketing managers, marketing specialists, Mid-level marketers, Professionals, executives need to opt to have expertized in this field to understand their business drivers and to extend their limits,

Curriculum

To become a successful Digital Marketer, a comprehensive curriculum covering different digital marketing disciplines will help you,
  • Grow your Business
  • Make Money
  • Land a High-Paying Job
  • Work as a Freelance Marketer

Top Digital Marketing Courses

Want to give your marketing career a boost? here are some of the handpicked digital marketing courses.

As search engines keep updating their algorithms to provide a better experience to its users, a person heading towards this field is expected to be skilled in a variety of areas, including analytics, copywriting, creative direction, sales, etc.

SEO
Content Marketing
PPC
Affiliate Marketing
Social Media Marketing
Search Engine Optimization
Email Marketing
Paid Search Advertising (Google Ads and Facebook)
Web Analytics
Content Marketing
Conversion Optimization

Highlights

To optimize presence in social media, marketers employ various strategies to target prospects by taking advantage of every innovation,

According to a report, a whopping 47% of companies have no particular marketing strategies and further employ no particular efforts to reevaluate a strong digital foundation. digital marketing has a lot to offer, being specific about what skills and courses one has to move upon we can have plenty of options at disposal moving quickly and adeptly that will make one stand out of the crowd.
“Technology allows people to maintain rich connections. Expressiveness and inventiveness can always master over big marketing propagandas
Maintaining a two-way communication is the best way to help traditional marketing efforts convert into sales with boundless opportunities.”

items.title: THE ENVOY OF FINANCIAL MARKETING
items.author: Shivangi Dixit
items.description:
“Never depend on a single income make the investment to create a second source to leverage assets to a higher level.”

We have been living in a culture where most people are forced to invest money. Rather creating the environment & awareness where you have the opportunity to grow money and secure wealth or to create other sources of assets. People have to suffer because of their status in different banks. Lack of profit, innovations in the economy which is lagging the nations behind.

OVERVIEW

Indians save about 30% of their disposable income, with annual savings totaling to >33,00B Rs. However, much of this has traditionally been invested in physical assets like real estate or gold, in low yielding bank FDs or, even worse, sits as cash, where savings are eaten away by deflation. Financial markets globally have offered the most efficient way for middle-class investors to compound their savings over the decades, but in India, retail investors shied away from in the past. Retail investor participation in Indian equities is < 3% today. This is significantly lower than the US (at ~55%) and even China (at ~7%).

Over the past few years, a revitalizing trend turnaround is seen. The growth in size and earnings of the middle class has surmounted a platform of the investor base.

The magnificence of the traditional saving grace class has stepped down. And SEBI’s reforms, such as efforts made to drive the growth of new investors and reduce commissions and expense ratios for investment products have provided further tailwinds. As a consequence, mutual fund SIPs have replaced fixed deposits as the preferred investment for first-time investors. In the last three years alone there are a continuous increase in stock market, >6M new mutual fund investors (~25M new folios) and >4M new stock market investors (~8M new Demat accounts) started to put their money into Indian financial markets.

But as the new investors began paddling into the markets, intended for a better investing experience, either found many of the present investment platforms to be too expensive , or too reliant on old-school offline models with online interfaces that were too clumpy and complex.

Today’s tech-savvy investors want to manage their investments on their smartphones and want products that are intuitive and user-friendly. They want fair pricing and expect the benefits of cheaper transaction processing and service to be passed to them.

SKILL DEVELOPMENT

Work-Life balance, Salary & Benefits, Job Security, Company culture, Career growth, Work Satisfaction are the traits that matter for the physical, economic growth of the firm.

If you think you have a quality product and needs funding for a small business like shops, street food, agriculture, design and more of innovation, if you want to reach your dream to the next level of the market, if you need a brand and connect to our authorized chain of brands for better exposure and business, if your product needs more research and analysis for better growth, if you are working on method business or doing small business with lots of research or experiment in it, to provide much quality service to people finance, investment is all that you need to replenish your growth in terms of marketing as,

“price is what you pay and value is what you get”.
